highlighted_text: Microprocessors handle data in chunks called words. The size of a word depends on the architecture of the microprocessor. When this chapter was written in 2012, most computers had 64-bit processors, indicating that they operate on 64-bit words. At the time, older computers handling 32-bit words were also widely available. Simpler microprocessors, especially those used in gadgets such as toasters, use 8- or 16-bit words.
A microprocessor is a processor built on a single chip.
Two’s complement numbers have the compelling advantage that addition works properly for both positive and negative numbers.
It should make sense that there is one more negative number than positive number because there is no −0.
overflow occurs if the two numbers being added have the same sign bit and the result has the opposite sign bit
the buffer might have desirable characteristics such as the ability to deliver large amounts of current to a motor or the ability to quickly send its output to many gates.
notes: Even if a buffer all it does is copiying the input value to the output, the reason why the component is used is because of its characteristics which could be to deliver a large amount of current or to bring the output of the buffer to many gates. At the logical level all it does is what a regular wire would do.

highlighted_text: The static discipline requires that, given logically valid inputs, every circuit element will produce logically valid outputs.
